medical_history.chief_complaint: Erythema, edema, warmth, and pain concerning for septic arthritis of the left knee.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a history of receiving vancomycin for prolonged treatments and developed severe shortness of breath, sensation of throat closing, hypoxemia, diffuse erythema, and wheezing during one of her recent admissions after administration of vancomycin. These symptoms resolved after discontinuation of the infusion and administration of epinephrine and other medications. Following a washout and debridement of her knee, she experienced worsened swelling, warmth, and erythema indicating unresolved infection two days after discharge.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Substance use disorder, bipolar disorder, depression, hypothyroidism, asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and multiple hospitalizations for cellulitis. Documented adverse reactions to multiple antibiotics including doxycycline (nausea and vomiting), sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim (anaphylaxis), and vancomycin (anaphylaxis).
medical_history.social_history: Acknowledged injection drug use while at home.
